src: nɤʑo cʰo aʑo ni, nɤki, rɟɤmtsʰu ɯ-taʁ nɯtɕu χsɯ-sŋi ɕɯ-nɤʁaʁ-tɕi, ɕɯ-nɤmɲole-tɕi.
trs: You and I will go on a three day tour on the sea.' (150827 mengjiangnv-zh, 216)

src: iɕqʰa tɯrme ra nɯ-rca ɣɤ<tɤ>ʑu
trs: (I saw) you among these people.' (elicited)

src: kɤ-mtsʰɤm maka ma<ta>ŋe tɕe, nɤ-kɯ-mŋɤm tu ɯβrɤ-ŋu ma, mɤ-kɯ-pe tu ɯβrɤ-ŋu ma nɯra nɯ-sɯso-t-a.
trs: (I) have not heard at all about you (for some time), I was wondering whether you have some disease, whether something bad happened to you.' (phone conversation, 16-12-28)

src: a-rkɯ mɯ-jɤ-tɯ-azɣɯt mɤɕtʂa mɯ-pɯ-ta-mtsʰɤm tɕe
trs: I did not feel your (presence) until you arrived near me.' (2012 Norbzang, 260)

src: tɕendɤre [tɤ-mu nɯ kɯ] ɕɯ ŋu nɯ maka mɯ-pjɤ-tso tɕeri
trs: The old woman did not realize who it was.' (2002 qaCpa, 242)

src: pja mɯndʐamɯχtɕɯɣ nɯ-skɤt a-pɯ-tɯ-tso smɯlɤm
trs: May you understand the speech of all species of birds!' (2003kandZislama, 85)

src: ci kɤ-pa-tɕi, nɯstʰɯci tɤ-nɤrʑaʁ ri, [nɯstʰɯci nɤ-ku ʑru rcanɯ] mɯ-kɤ-tso-a
trs: So much time has passed since we have married, I did not realize that your hair was so long.' (2003 Kunbzang, 467)

src: a-ʁi, nɤʑo ɯ-ɲɯ-fse-a?
trs: Sister, do I look like you?' (2014-kWlAG, 475)

src: nɤʑo nɯ-apa-a
trs: I became you.' (elicited)

src: aʑo nɯ-tɯ-apa
trs: You became me.' (elicited)

src: ʁnɯz ni, [sɯŋgɯ] jo-ɕe-ndʑi.
trs: Two (men) went into the forest.' (26-tAGe, 1)

src: tɕhemɤpɯ nɯ kɯ ɯ-wa cʰo ɯ-pi nɯra ɲɤ-βde tɕe, sɯŋgɯ ɯ-ɕki tɕe jo-ɕe.
trs: The girl left her father and her brothers, and went toward the forest.' (140506 shizi he huichang de bailingniao, 76)

src: tɯrme ɯ-ɕki tu-rɯɕmi-a ɕti wo
trs: I am talking to someone (else).' (phone conversation, 2013-12-02)

src: <guojia> ɯ-pʰe <piaozi> ɲɯ-kɯ-sɤ-mbi
trs: Ask the government for money.' (2010, 09)

src: tɕe a-pi a-ʁi ra kutɕu a-nɯ-tɯ-ɤnɯɣro-nɯ, ci ci a-tɤ-tɯ-ɤnɯmqaj-nɯ, ci ci a-tɤ-tɯ-ɤmɯmi-nɯ qʰe a-kɤ-tɯ-nɯ-rɤʑi-nɯ,
trs: Brothers, stay here and play, fight from time to time, reconcile with each other from time to time.' (2003kandzwsqhaj, 43)

src: <maerjina> nɯ cʰo <alibaba> ni wuma ʑo pjɤ-k-ɤmɯmi-ndʑi tɕe
trs: Maerjina and Alibaba were in very good terms.' (140512 alibaba-zh, 306)

src: tɕeki qro ni ɲɯ-ɤlɯlɤt-ndʑi
trs: Down there two ants are fighting.' (conversation140501-01)

src: ki ɕɯŋgɯ ki pɯpɯŋunɤ, nɤʑo kɯ iɕqʰa mkʰɤrmaŋ ɣɯ nɯ-ndʐa kɯ tɤ-tɯ-alɯlɤt pɯ-ŋu tɕe,
trs: The previous time, you fought for the sake of the people.' (140512 abide he mogui-zh, 89)

src: ndʑi-tɯ-wxti ɲɯ-naχtɕɯɣ
trs: They have the same size.' (`Their size is the same.') (24-ZmbrWpGa, 24)

src: aʑo a-me nɯ [nɤʑɯɣ nɤ-rʑaβ ɲɯ-kʰam-a] jɤɣ, [nɤ-rʑaβ a-kɤ-βze] jɤɣ
trs: (If you succeed), I will agree to give my daughter to you in marriage, she can become your wife (140518 huifei de muma-zh, 71)

src: nɯ-mbrɯ a-mɤ-tɤ-ŋgɯ, a nɯ-ʁo a-mɤ-nɯ-mbi
trs: Don't be angry, don't feel frustrated.' (2003kAndzwsqhaj2, 128)

src: nɯ a-ʁjiz ɣi ɕti
trs: I want that.' (140520 xiaoyida de huar-zh, 63)

src: tɤ-lu to-rpjɯ
trs: The milk turned sour.' (elicited)

src: qʰaqʰu mɤʑɯ ɲɯ-ɣɯtshɤdɯɣ
trs: It feels even hotter behind the house.' (conversation 14-05-10)

src: tɕe ɕɤr wuma ʑo kɤ-qanɯ tɕe
trs: In the night, when it has become very dark.' (23-qapGAmtWmtW, 141)

src: tɕendɤre tɯ-mɯ ɯ-tɯ-ɣɯtsʰɤdɯɣ pjɤ-sɤre ʑo tɕe,
trs: (140512 fushang he yaomo-zh, 6)

src: tʰɯ-nɯ-ɕe ma, mɤ-tɯ-ra
trs: Go back, (I) don't need you.' (2002 qaCpa, 31)

src: ɕlaʁ pjɯ-si ɕɯŋgɯ qʰe ɯ-ɕa ɯ-ndza tu-ʑa-nɯ.
trs: They start eating its flesh just before it dies.' (20-sWNgi, 57)

src: aʑo tɯ-tso kɤ-ʑa-t-a
trs: I began to understand.' (elicited)

src: tɕe iʑo ji-kʰa kɯnɤ kɤ-fstɯn-i pɯ-ra
trs: We also had to take care of him in our house.' (14-siblings, 360)

src: nɤ-wɯ cʰo nɤ-ʁi ni pjɯ-sat-i ŋu
trs: We will kill your grandfather and your brother.' (2011-05-nyima, 132)

src: nɤʑo tɯrme ra to-tɯ-ɣɯt tɕe,
trs: You(\textsc{sg}) brought people (here).' (150901 changfamei, 155)

src: ndʑi-jɯlco ra kɯ wuma pjɤ́-wɣ-nɤsma-ndʑi.
trs: Their neighbours envied the two of them.' (qajdoskAt, 14)

src: tɕe aʑo tu-ta-fsraŋ ra tɕe,
trs: I have to save you.' (150901 changfamei-zh, 219)

src: wortɕʰi wojɤr ʑo tu-kɯ-qur-i ra
trs: Please, help us.' (150827 taisui-zh, 22)

src: <chuhuaiwang> cʰo nɯra, kɯmaʁ nɯra nɯ-ɕki, ``ɣɯ-tu-kɯ-qur-i ɲɯ-ntsʰi" z-jo-sɯ-ti.
trs: He sent (someone) to the king Huai of Chu and the other ones to tell them `Come and help us'. (160721 pofuchenzhou-zh, 26)

src: ma-tʰɯ-kɯ-βlɯ-a, tɕʰorzi ɯ-ŋgɯ cʰɯ-kɯ-rku-a
trs: Don't burn me, put me in a wine jar.' (2003 Kunbzang, 385)

src: khɛnɛʔ  anchi aina-o a-dha:p-si-ba kɛ-ni
trs: You(sg) saw both of us in the mirror.’ (\citealt[277]{driem90hayu})

src: [χɕɤlzgoŋ ɯ-ŋgɯ kɤ-ntɕʰɤr-tɕi] nɯra pɯ-mto-t-a
trs: I saw both of us in the mirror.' (elicitation, \citealt[85]{jacques12agreement})

src: mɯ́j-tɯ-mbɣom ri tʰa kɯ-z-maqʰu-tɕi
trs: (If) you don't hurry (up), you will get us late.' (elicited)

src: ma tú-wɣ-ndza tɕe, ɲɯ-kɯ-z-nɯtɯfɕɤl ɕti
trs: If you eat (mold), it causes you diarrhea.' (20-sWrna, 56)

src: rasti cʰo rɤjndoʁ ni, pjɯ́-wɣ-ʁndzɤr-ndʑi tɕe ɲɯ́-wɣ-z-nɯɴɢɤt-ndʑi ŋu.
trs: One separates the turnip from its root by cutting them.' (150903 kAJar, 7)

src: tɯ-rdoʁ tsa rɤʑi-j tɕe tú-wɣ-qur-nɯ raʁmaʁ
trs: Let at least one of us stay here and help them!' (hist180503 xiyouji 12-zh, 78)

src: qaʑo cʰɯ-krɤɣ-nɯ tɕe tɤ-pɤtso ra kɯ nɯ qaʑo ɣɯ ɯ-ku nɯ ku-kɯ-sɯ-ndo.
trs: (Every time the adults) sheared the sheep's wool, they would ask the children (us) to grab the sheep's head.' (160712 smAG, 2)

src: tu-ndze-a-ndʑi ra
trs: I'd like to eat them.' (lWlu2002, 69)

src: tu-kɯ-nɯmɢla-a jɤɣ ma nɤ-pi ni kɯ tɤ́-wɣ-nɯmɢla-a-ndʑi ɕti
trs: You can step over me, your two elder sister stepped over me.' (Kunbzang, 31)

imtwordshtml: total\redp{}aor-see-pst:tr-1sg-pl
src: nɯnɯ [tɕʰeme pɯ\redp{}pɯ-mto-t-a-nɯ] ɯ-ŋgɯ nɯ kɯ-fse kɯ-mpɕɤr maŋe
trs: This is the most beautiful among all the girls I have ever seen.' (150818 muzhi guniang-zh, 505)

src: to-k-ɤlɯlɤt-ndʑi-ci
trs: They fought each other.

src: tɯɲɤt tʰɯ-ɣe nɯ ɯ-rca nɯtɕu tɕe, nɯŋa pɯ-kɯ-nɯrɯ nɯ tɤrca cʰɤ́-wɣ-ɣɯt, tɯ-rdoʁ. tɕe nɯnɯ cʰɤ́-wɣ-ɣɯt tɕendɤre iɕqʰa nɯ, nɤki tɯ-ci kɯ cʰɤ́-wɣ-ɣɯt qʰe
trs: There was a landslide, and together with it, a grazing cow was taken away, the water took it away.' (160715 nWNa, 5-6)

src: pɤŋɤxɕaj nɤki, kʰɯna kɯ tu-ndze tɕe lú-wɣ-sɯ-qioʁ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The plantcalled) \forme{pɤŋɤxɕaj}$_i$, when a dog$_j$ eats it$_i$, it makes it$_j$ vomit.' (140505 panaxCAj, 3)

src: <yancong> ɯ-ŋgɯ ɲɯ-ɲaʁ rcanɯ, tɕe kumpɣɤtɕɯ ra ɲɤ́-wɣ-sɯɣ-ɲaʁ-nɯ ʑo, nɯ-kɯ-ɤkʰra ra mɯ-ɲɤ-χsɤl ʑo tɕendɤre ʑɯrɯʑɤri qale tu-βze, tɯmɯ kɯ pjɯ́-wɣ-χtɕi-nɯ tɕe ɲɯ-me ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: As it is black inside the chimney, the sparrows were completely blackened by it, the patterns and colours (on their feathers) were not visible any more, but progressively, the wind and the rain wash them away and (the soot on their feathers) disappears.

src: cɯrmbɯ ɯ-taʁ nɯ nɯ-z-rɤʑi ɲɤ-me ma tɯ-ci to-ɣi qʰe, tɕendɤre nɤki βʑɯ ra kɤsɯfse tʰa-nɯ-tsɯm. qʰe pɯ-si-nɯ.
trs: The place where they$_j$ stayed on the stone heap disappeared as the water$_i$ came up, and it$_i$ took the mice$_j$ downstream. And they$_j$ died.  (150831 BZW kAnArRaR, 95)

src: ``mtsʰoʁlaŋ ni a-kʰɤkɯm, nɤki, a-kʰɯna ʑo a-pɯ-fse-ndʑi ra" to-ti ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe mtsʰoʁlaŋ ni kɯ pjɤ́-wɣ-nɤliɤliɤt ʑo ɕti
trs: He said `May the water monsters be like dogs on my doorstep' and the water monsters greeted him like dogs.' (Norbzang 2012, 205-206)

src: ɯ-mpʰɯz nɯnɯ tɤjpɣom kɯ pjɤ-ndo qʰendɤre,
trs: His buttocks were stuck on the ice.' (140427 qala cho kWrtsAG, 37)

src: rɟɤlpu nɯ kɯ [ɯ-mɲaʁ ɲɤ-z-nɤmbju] ʑo pjɤ-mto tɕe,
trs: The king$_j$ saw it (the thread)$_i$ as it$_i$ dazzled his$_j$ eyes.'  (2012 Norbzang, 151-152)

src: ɯ-rkɯ nɯtɕu, si kɯ-wxti a-pɯ-tu tɕe ɲɯ́-wɣ-z-maqʰu qʰe ɯʑo tu-mbro mɯ́j-cʰa.
trs: If there is a big tree$_j$ next to it$_i$, it$_j$ delays its$_i$ growth and it$_i$ cannot grow very big.' (14-sWNgWJu, 242)

src: tɕendɤre rɟɤlpu ɣɯ ɯ-rʑaβ ɲɤ-k-ɤβzu-ci tɕe, tɕe ɯ-pi ni kɯ wuma ʑo, nɤkinɯ, pjɤ́-wɣ-nɤʑɤmŋɤn
trs: She$_i$ became the queen, and her$_i$ sisters were envious of her$_i$.' (140514 huishuohua de niao-zh, 15)

src: kɯɕnɯ-sŋi kɯɕnɤ-rʑaʁ nɯ́-wɣ-z-nɤʁaʁ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The king) let (Padma 'Od'bar) have a good time for seven days and seven nights.' (Norbzang 2005, 202)

src: tɕendɤre ``jɤɣ" ti nɤ χsɤrzaŋ nɯ́-wɣ-ɕɯ-rŋo-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The king) said `yes' and lent the Gserbzang to (the three girls).'(Norbzang 2005, 406; girls > king)

src: tɕendɤre rɟɤlpu kɯ na-nɯsŋom ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: The king envied (Padma 'Od'bar).' (Norbzang 2005, 374)

src: tɕendɤre tɕetu ndɤre, pɤnmawombɤr ka-tɕɤβ-nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: (The king and his servants) burned Padma 'Od'bar up there.' (Norbzang 2005, 389)

src: tɕendɤre tɤ-wɯ nɯ kɯ ɲɤ́-wɣ-ngɤjtsʰi tɕe, nɤki, tɯmgo ɲɤ́-wɣ-mbi, tɯ-ci ra ɲɤ́-wɣ-j-tsʰi tó-wɣ-ɕɯ-fka tɕe tɕe
trs: The old man gave him food and drinks, gave him food to eat, water to drink, gave him enough for him to eat his fill.' (2011-05-nyima, 88-89)

imt: \textsc{lnk} \textsc{dem} about \textsc{lnk} \textsc{indef} \textsc{dem}:\textsc{du} \textsc{erg} cat \textsc{erg} \textsc{inv}-eat:\textsc{fact}-\textsc{1du} \textsc{pl} \textsc{neg}-\textsc{ifr}-think-\textsc{du} \textsc{erg} \textsc{1sg} be.right:\textsc{fact}-\textsc{1sg} \textsc{add} \textsc{1sg} be.right:\textsc{fact}-\textsc{1sg} \textsc{ifr}-think-\textsc{du} \textsc{lnk} cat \textsc{dem} \textsc{erg} one \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{east}-grab one \textsc{ifr}:\textsc{west}-grab \textsc{lnk} \textsc{lnk} both \textsc{emph} \textsc{ifr}-\textsc{inv}-eat-\textsc{du} \textsc{lnk}
src: tɕe nɯ jamar tɕe ci nɯni kɯ ``lɯlu kɯ ɣɯ́-ndza-tɕi" ra mɯ-ɲɤ-sɯso-ndʑi kɯ, ``aʑo ɣɤŋgi-a nɤ aʑo ɣɤŋgi-a" ɲɤ-sɯso-ndʑi, tɕendɤre lɯlu nɯ kɯ ci ko-mɟa, ci ɲo-mɟa tɕe, ndɤre ʁnaʁna ʑo cʰɤ́-wɣ-ndza-ndʑi tɕe,
trs: The other two were not thinking `The cat will eat us', but rather `I am right, I am right', and the cat grabbed one on his left and one on his right, and both ended up eaten by him.' (lWlu 2002, 76-79)

src: rɟɤlpu ɣɯ ɯ-ʁjoʁ nɯra kɯ ɲimawozɤr, nɯnɯ ɣɤrɤt-nɯ pjɤ-ŋu, ɣɯ-tsɯm pjɤ-ŋu tɕeri,
trs: As the king's servants were about to throw him (into the lake), to take him (there).' (Nyima wodzer2002, 114-115)

src: tɕendɤre ri, ku-rtoʁ tɕe ɯ-tɯ-ci nɯra pjɤ́-wɣ-lwoʁ tɕe kɯ-tu pjɤ-me qhe,
trs: He$_i$ realized that someone had spilled the water (in his$_i$ gourd), and none was left.' (140505 liuhaohan zoubian tianxia-zh, 194)

src: tɤŋe na-βzu qʰe ɲɯ-me ɕti.
trs: It disappears when the sun appears.' (25-RmArYWG, 36)

src: akɯcʰoʁle nɯ to-βzu tɕe rcanɯ,
trs: The East (North) Wind blew.' (aesop feng he taiyang-zh, 9)

src: tɤrtsa kɯ-wxti tsa tɯ-βzu to-ʑa.
trs: There started to be big waves (on the sea).' (140430 yufu he tade qizi-zh, 100)

src: tɕendɤre cʰa ɯ-skɤt ɯ-βzu lo-ʑa.
trs: He started drunk-talking.' (150906 qingfeng-zh, 66)

src: tɤ-βlɯ-a
trs: I made a fire'. (elicited; \textsc{1sg}:\textsc{intr})

src: smi tɤ-βlɯ-t-a
trs: I made a fire'. (elicited; \textsc{1sg}\fl{}3)

src: tɕʰeme ci pɯ-taʁ ɲɯ-ŋu,
trs: A girl was weaving.' (tWxsta2003, 28)

src: nɯnɯ mɯntoʁ nɯ tʰa-taʁ tɕe,
trs: (When) he wove this pattern, ...' (150825 huluwa, 98)

src: cɯ ɲɯ́-wɣ-pʰɯt, tu-kɯ-ɕlu,
trs: One has to take out the stones, to plough,' (2010, 10, 11)

src: tɯ-ji nɯ lú-wɣ-ɕlu tɕe
trs: One ploughs the fields, and ...' (07-tWsqar, 21)

src: ɯ-mɲaʁ nɯ wuma ɲɯ-mto ɲɯ-ʂa ɲɯ-ŋu nɤ́ma,
trs: The (eagle) has a sharp eyesight.' 140522 Kamnyu zgo, 226

src: tɕe nɯ aj pjɯ-sɯso-a tɕe nɯnɯ tɯ-tɯpʰu ɲɯ-ŋu-ndʑi tɕe
trs: In my opinion, these two (animals belong to) the same species.' (20-ldWGi, 45)

src: pjɯ-rɯ-sɯso nɤ pjɯ-rɯ-sɯso tɕe,
trs: He thought about it over and over.' (02-deluge2012, 63)

src: tɕʰeme nɯ tɕe tɕe ɯ-kʰa nɯtɕu ko-z-rɤʑi tɕe, ɲɯ-nɯʁjoʁ tu-z-rɤme pjɤ-ŋu.
trs: The witch kept the girl in the house, and gave her orders and put her to work.' (140507 tangguowu-zh, 110-111)

src: sŋi qʰe z-ɲɯ-nɯʁjoʁ tɕe kɯβʁa ra nɯ-ma z-ɲɯ-nɤme
trs: In the day, he would work as a servant, and do work for the nobles.' (150828 donglang, 10)

src: ɯ-tɕɯ ʁnɯz nɯ pjɤ-si, tɯ-rdoʁ nɯ ɲɤ-ri qʰe
trs: Two of her sons died, and one remained (alive).' (Gesar 2003, 315)

src: a-sroʁ kɤ-tɯ-ri-t
trs: You saved my life.' (150906 qingfeng-zh, 121)

src: a-ku kɯm ɯ-taʁ kɤ-nɯ-rpu-t-a
trs: I bumped my head against the (top frame of the) door.' (elicited)

src: maka ʑo mɯ-kɤ-rpu-a tɕe mɯ-tɤ-nɯɣmaz-a
trs: I did not hit (the bottom) and was not injured.' (150824 kelaosi-zh, 190)

src: aʑo a-zgroʁ sqʰi ɯ-taʁ ku-nɯ-rpe-a ndʐa ɕti
trs: This is because (I accidentally made) my bracelet clang against the tripod.' (tWxtsa 2003, 52)

src: nɯ-sɤŋo je
trs: Listen!' (140516 guowang halifa-zh, 76)

src: nɤ-ŋga ɲɯ-rtaʁ ɕi mɯ́j-rtaʁ kɯ nɯ-sɤŋo
trs: Make sure (literally `feel whether') you have enough clothes.' (elicited)

src: <xiaoqian> nɯ wuma ʑo tɕʰeme ɲɯ-pe, ɲɯ-sɤ-sɤŋo,
trs: Xiaoqian is a very nice girl, she is obedient.' (150907 niexiaoqian-zh, 166)

src: iɕqʰa tɯmɲa nɯ cʰa pjɤ-rga qʰe
trs: (Gesar's) arrows like (to drink) alcohol.' (Gesar, 352)

src: ʁzɤmi ni wuma ʑo pjɤ-rga-ndʑi.
trs: The husband and his wife were very happy.' (140506 woju guniang-zh, 10)

src: nɤ-tʂɯnlɤn ɲɯ-ta-fsɯɣ ra
trs: I have to return the favour.' (150827 tianluo-zh, 145)

src: nɤ-tʂɯnlɤn ɲɯ-nɯ-fsɯɣ-a
trs: I will return the favour.' (elicited, adapted from example \ref{ex:nAtsxWnlAn.YWtafsWG})

src: rɟɤlpu nɯ kɯ tɯtɯrca kʰa ɯ-ŋgɯ jó-wɣ-tsɯm-ndʑi
trs: The king brought them together into a house.' (140505 liuhaohan zoubian tianxia-zh, 142)

src: ɯnɯnɯtɕu tɯ-tɯpɯ pjɤ-tu-nɯ
trs: there was one household there.' (140512 yufu yu mogui-zh, 3)

src: kɤndʑi-xtɤɣ χsɯm pjɤ-tu-nɯ
trs: There were three brothers.' (31-deluge, 7)

src: nɯnɯreri tsʰɤko ʁnɯz tu.
trs: There are two stone mounts there.' (140522 Kamnyu zgo, 138)

src: kɯɕɯŋgɯ tɕe, ʁzɤmi ci pjɤ-tu-ndʑi tɕe, ndʑi-tɕɯ χsɯm pjɤ-tu.
trs: Long ago, there was a husband and his wife, and they had three sons.' (140430 jin e-zh, 2)

src: tɕe lɤ-zo-nɯ kɯnɤ tɯtɯrca lu-zo-nɯ, tʰɯ-nɯqambɯmbjom-nɯ kɯnɤ tɯtɯrca cʰɯ-nɯqambɯmbjom-nɯ,
trs: When they land they all land together, when they fly they all fly together.' (24-qro, 10)

src: tɯtɯrca kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn tu-ɬoʁ-nɯ ŋu.
trs: They grow together in great numbers.' (21-jmAGni, 82)

src: kɯ-dɯ\redp{}dɤn ʑo tɯtɯrca tu-ɬoʁ ŋu.
trs: They grow together in great numbers.'  (21-jmAGni, 84)

src: ɯ-rɟit kɯngɯt tɤ-tu ri, kɯtʂɤɣ nɯ-si. kɯtʂɤɣ nɯ-si-nɯ qʰe
trs: She had nine children, six (of them) died. Six died, and...' (14-siblings, 17-18)

src: kɤndʑi-ʁi ni s-cʰɯ́-wɣ-qru ŋu
trs: Let's invite the two brothers down here.' (Nyima wodzer2003-2, 115)

src: a-tɤɕime ra, ci ɲɯ-ɣɯtsʰɤdɯɣ tɕe, kɤ-nɯ-rŋgɯ-nɯ
trs: My lady, it is a bit hot, lie down (to sleep).' (2014-kWlAG, 232)

src: tɕeri tɤ-mu nɯ kɯ rɟɤlpu ra mɤ-rɤʑi-nɯ tɕe, pɣɤtɕɯ nɯ pjɤ-sɯ-sat.
trs: The woman had the bird killed while the king was away.' (2014-kWlAG, 590)

src: wo a-ʑi ra tɕʰindʐa ɲɯ-tɯ-nɤre ŋu
trs: My lady, why are you laughing?' (2005 Kunbzang, 245)

src: ``tɯ-rdoʁ kɯ a-sci a-tʰɯ-ndo-nɯ ntsʰi" ɲɯ-sɯsɤm pjɤ-ŋu
trs: (The king) was thinking: `One of (my sons) should inherit the throne.'' (140510 sanpian yumao-zh, 7)

src: iʑora tɕe ɕkɤpʰɤr tu-ti-nɯ tsuku kɯ ɕkɤjwaʁ tu-ti-nɯ ŋu ma
trs: Among us, some call it \forme{ɕkɤpʰɤr}, some \forme{ɕkɤjwaʁ}.' (07-Cku, 82)

src: mɤ-xsi ko, nɯra ɲɤ-nɯ-jmɯt-a
trs: I don't know, I forgot about these things.' (phone conversation, 2013-12-24)

src: skalpa ndʑɯɣ nɯ ɲɯ-ŋu tɕe, ji-nɯŋa pjɯ́-wɣ-nɯ-ntɕʰa ɲɯ-ntsʰi
trs: The world is about to be destroyed, let us kill our cow.' (07-deluge, 7)

src: iʑo kɯ-mɤku pɤjkʰu, ɯ-ɕɣa kɯ-mtɕoʁ nɯ ci ɲɯ́-wɣ-pʰɯt
trs: Let us first take out its sharp teeth.' (150908 menglang-zh, 80)

src: iʑo kɯrɯ ra, nɤkinɯ, qajɣi lú-wɣ-nɯ-βzu tɕe
trs: We Tibetans, when we make bread,' (160706 thotsi, 1)

src: tɕe jinde aj pɯ-mto-t-a me ri, pɯ-kɯ-xtɕi tɕe pɯ́-wɣ-mto
trs: I have not seen any (wild crane) recently, but when we were young, we did see it.' (22-qomndroN, 35)

src: ʁʑɯnɯ tɕʰemɤli ra, ɲo-ta-nɯ tɕe, ɲo-ta tɕe,
trs: She left (there) the young men and women.' (2003kandzWsqhaj, 35)

src: oma, kɯβde pjɤ-sɯ-ɣe nɤ! kɯβde pjɤ-sɯ-ɣe qʰe, nɯnɯra ɲɤ-nɤrɯra-ndʑi ri, ɲɤ-nɤrɯra-nɯ ri,
trs: He sent four (of his daughters, not three), he sent four of them, and they looked around.' (150826 baoliandeng-zh, 223)

src: ndɤre ɯ-pi ra kɯ lɤ́-wɣ-ɕaβ-ndʑi nɤ kɤ-akʰu-ndʑi ɲɯ-ŋu.
trs: Her elder sisters and the others caught up with them and called.' (2005 Kunbzang, 155)

src: nɯnɯ kɯ-fse ʁnɯz jɤ-ɣe-ndʑi tɕe,  ji-kʰa zɯ jɤ-ɣe tɕe
trs: Two (ghosts) like that came, came to our house.' (150902 qixian-zh, 139)

src: nɯŋa ra tɕi kɤ-ndza rga-nɯ, tɯrme kɯ tú-wɣ-ndza mɤ-sna.
trs: Cows like to eat it, but it is not good for people.' (11-paRzwamWntoR, 39-40)

src: tɕe lɯlu nɯ wuma ʑo pe tɕe, nɯnɯ, tɯrme ra kɯ nɯ nɯ-rga-nɯ tɕe
trs: The cat is a very nice (animal), people like it.' (21-lWLU, 41)

src: tɕe wuma ʑo mɯ\redp{}mɤ-pɯ-kɯ-tso nɤ mɤ́-wɣ-mto
trs: If you do not know it well, you won't see it.'   (07-Cku, 59)

src: tɕeri tɤ-pɤtso pɯ-kɯ-ŋu tɕe, nɯ kɤ-ndza wuma ʑo pɯ-kɯ-rga.
trs: When we were children, we used to like eating it a lot.' (12-ndZiNgri, 138)

imt: \textsc{dem} Chinese \textsc{erg} setaria.viridis \textsc{ipfv}-say be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}  Tibetan \textsc{pl} \textsc{erg} \textsc{dem} again setaria.viridis \textsc{ipfv}-\textsc{genr}-say be:\textsc{fact}be:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk}
src: nɯnɯ kupa kɯ <gouweicao> tu-ti ŋu tɕe, kɯrɯ ra kɯ nɯ li khɯnajme tu-kɯ-ti ŋu tɕe,
trs: The Chinese call it `gouweicao', Tibetans call it \forme{khɯnajme}.' (16-RlWmsWsi, 54)

imt: \textsc{lnk} be.poisonous:\textsc{fact} \textsc{ipfv}-say-\textsc{pl} be.usually.the.case:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{irr}-\textsc{pfv}-recognize-\textsc{pl} \textsc{advers} \textsc{lnk} at.all \textsc{neg}-take.out:\textsc{fact}-\textsc{pl} \textsc{aor}:3\fl{}3$'$-take.out-\textsc{pl} even \textsc{ipfv}-throw.away-\textsc{pl} be.\textsc{aff}:\textsc{fact} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{aor}-tread-\textsc{pl} \textsc{lnk} people \textsc{pl} \textsc{erg} \textsc{irr}-\textsc{neg}-\textsc{pfv}-take-\textsc{pl} \textsc{lnk} \textsc{inv}-\textsc{caus}-be.poisoned:\textsc{fact}-\textsc{pl} \textsc{sens}-think-\textsc{pl}
src: tɕe sɤndɤɣ tu-ti-nɯ ŋgrɤl. tɕe a-pɯ-sɯχsɤl-nɯ ʁo tɕe maka mɤ-pʰɯt-nɯ, na-phɯt-nɯ kɯnɤ cʰɯ-βde-nɯ ɕti. tɕe pjɯ-rɤtɕɯmtɕaʁ-nɯ ma `tɯrme ra kɯ a-mɤ-tɤ-ndo-nɯ ma ɣɯ-z-nɤndɤɣ-nɯ' ɲɯ-sɯso-nɯ.
trs: People say that (this species of mushroom) is poisonous. If they recognize it, they don't pick it up, even if they pick it up they throw it away and stamp on it, thinking `(This way) other people won't take it and it will not poison them.'' (23-grWBgrWBftsa, 23-27)

src: tɕe ɯ-sɤ-rma nɯnɯ, praʁ, praʁpa tɕe ɕ-ku-rma ɲɯ-ŋu
trs: The place where its spends the night is the cliffs, it goes to spend the night in caverns under the cliffs.' (20-xsar, 36)

src: tɤ-ɤstu (je)
trs: Goodbye' = `(walk) straight' (singular)

src: tɤ-ɤstu-ndʑi (je)
trs: Goodbye' (dual)

src: ɯ-ku-tɯ-nɤβdi? ɯ-ku-tɯ-pe?
trs: Do you feel well, are you fine?' (conversation, 16-12-28)

src: tɕiʑo ndɤ dɯxpa-tɕi ɣe, nɤ tɕendɤre, kɤ-ntɕha ɯ-spa ʑo ɕti-tɕi
trs: We, on the other hand, poor of us! We are to be butchered.' (kandZislama2003.210)

src: ndʑi-ɣi ra, nɯni mɯ-ɲɤ-k-ɤtɯɣ-nɯ-ci, pjɤ-sɤzdɯɣpa-nɯ ma
trs: Their relatives did not meet them (again), poor them.' (2003zrantCWtWrme, 78)

src: [ŋa kə-ʃî-ŋ]=tə teɲê tsə̂s-ŋ
trs: I will say what I know about.' (Cogtse dialect, \citealt[72]{linyj16cogtse})

src: [sanam-scə̄t kə no-kə-o-mbə̂-ŋ] tə, <zengguangxianwen> u-tʰiɛ̂ ˈnə-ŋɐs
trs: What Bsod nams Skyid gave me is the book `Zengguan xianwen.'' (Bragbar dialect, \citealt{zhangshuya20these})
